text:
:wave: I'd like to demonstrate to a prospective employer that using Julia is not only feasible but to their advantage. I was asked to write a proof of concept API utilising machine learning to return the sentiment of a tweet or classifying an image for instance, and save the request/response to a database.
I'm fairly new to Julia but eager to learn it well and use it at work. Web APIs aren't my strong point yet. 
My thought is to use Pluto.jl (frontend?), Genie.jl (RESTful?), Flux.jl (ML). Does this sound like a feasible and/or reasonable tech stack to use, for addressing this tech challenge, in your opinion? Many thanks
